free_text.Bibliographie et matériel: [li]Handouts given during the course.[br/][li]A number of papers will be suggested or discussed [br/][br/]Some sections of the following books will be discussed:[br/][li]Intermolecular and Surface Forces, J. Israelachvili, Academic press[br/][li]Surface Plasmon resonance Based Sensors, J.Homola et al., Springer[br/][li]Surface Design: Applications in Bioscience and Nanotechnology, R. Forch, H. Schonherr, A.T. Jenkins, Wiley[br/][li]Bioelectronics: From Theory to Applications, I. Willner, E. Katz, Wiley[br/]
free_text.Contenu: The core of the course is organized in 5 chapters and is preceded by an introduction meant to give the basic glossary and terminology.[br/]The course will present and discuss some of the techniques that are addressed to interface or surface sensing. i.e. that are based on the analysis of events  which take place on a sensing surface. [br/][br/]The 5 Chapters are:[br/][li]Impedance-based measurement systems for molecular binding detection and membranes interactions analysis [br/][li]Optical-based systems based on the change of intrinsic properties of the interface (Surface Plasmon Resonance, Wave guides)[br/][li]Field-effect-based sensing (EISField-Effect Transistors, CHEMFET, Organic FET, Silicon NanoWires)[br/][li]Mass and surface stress biosensors (QCM, cantilevers)[br/][li]Surface chemistry and surface design for biosensors. Smart interfaces, nano-particles.
free_text.Objectifs d'apprentissage: The field of biosensors and biochips covers a wide range of applications such as the detection and analysis of molecular interactions, membrane interactions and cells.[br/]The course is intended to present a number of significant  (consolidated or emerging) biosensors techniques employed in commercial and research fields and to give insights on the underlying sensing principles.[br/]The importance of the role of interdisciplinary researchers and engineers in the development of such systems will be stressed and practically shown by the exercise sessions.
